Let $ n$ be the largest integer that is the product of exactly $ 3$ distinct prime numbers, $ d$, $ e$, and $ 10d+e$, where $ d$ and $ e$ are single digits. What is the sum of the digits of $ n$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 12 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 15 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 18 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 21 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 24$
